---
title: 'run'
description: "Execute a built artifact and write output"
---

Execute a built expression and write results to a file or stdout. The build must have been created with `xorq build` or `xorq uv-build`.

## Usage

Pass a build path (or alias) and optional output path and format.

```bash
xorq run <build_path> [OPTIONS]
```

## Arguments

The build to execute.

| Argument | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `build_path` | Alias, catalog entry ID, build ID, or path to the build directory |

## Options

Where to write output and how to format it.

| Option | Short | Default | Description |
|--------|-------|---------|-------------|
| `--output-path` | `-o` | (discard) | Where to write output; use `-` for stdout |
| `--format` | `-f` | `parquet` | Output format: `csv`, `json`, `parquet`, or `arrow` |
| `--limit` | | | Limit number of rows to output |
| `--cache-dir` | | (system cache) | Directory for parquet cache files |

## Examples

Common usage patterns.

Write Parquet to a file:

```bash
xorq run builds/f02d28198715 --output-path results.parquet
```

Stream CSV to stdout:

```bash
xorq run builds/f02d28198715 -o - -f csv
```

Run without saving output (e.g. for validation):

```bash
xorq run builds/f02d28198715
```
